cards.name: Yawgmoth Demon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you don't, tap Yawgmoth Demon and it deals 2 damage to you.

rulings.text: The sacrificing of an artifact is not mandatory. You can choose not to sacrifice an artifact but will pay the consequences.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you don't, tap Yawgmoth Demon and it deals 2 damage to you.

cards.name: Zombify
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it."
—Mystic elder
cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Anaba Shaman
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Just try taking this bull by the horns.

foreignNames.name: アナーバのシャーマン

cards.originalText: {R}, {T}: Anaba Shaman deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Anarchist
cards.text: When Anarchist enters the battlefield, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Those who will not follow are doomed to lead.
cards.originalText: When Anarchist comes into play, you may return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Balduvian Barbarians
cards.flavor:
"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor,
To the canyons of Bandu,
We drink and fight and feast and die
As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song

foreignNames.name: バルデュヴィアの蛮族

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Fire never dies alone.
cards.originalText: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Blood Moon
cards.text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.
cards.flavor: Heavy light flooded across the landscape, cloaking everything in deep crimson.

rulings.text: If a nonbasic land has an ability that causes it to enter the battlefield tapped, it will lose that ability before it applies. The same is also true of any other abilities that modify how a land enters the battlefield or apply "as" a land enters the battlefield, such as the first ability of Cavern of Souls. This is a change from previous rulings.
Nonbasic lands will lose any other land types and abilities they had. They will gain the land type Mountain and gain the ability "{T}: Add {R}."
This effect doesn't affect names or supertypes. It won't turn any land into a basic land or remove the legendary supertype from a legendary land, and the lands won't be named "Mountain."
If a nonbasic land has an ability that triggers "when" it enters the battlefield, it will lose that ability before it triggers.

cards.originalText: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.

cards.name: Bloodfire Colossus
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Colossus: Bloodfire Colossus deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: It took all its strength to contain the fire within.
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Colossus: Bloodfire Colossus deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Boiling Seas
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.flavor: What burns the land, boils the seas.
cards.originalText: Destroy all Islands.

cards.name: Demolish
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land.
cards.flavor:
"Pound the steel until it fits.
Doesn't work? Bash to bits."
—Dwarven forging song
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or land.

cards.name: Enrage
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The barbarians call it "touching the soul of the dragon."
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Firebreathing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: This ability can be activated by Firebreathing's controller, not the enchanted creature's controller (in case they're different players).
The ability affects whichever creature is enchanted by Firebreathing at the time the ability resolves. The bonus remains even if Firebreathing stops enchanting that creature.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Flame Wave
cards.text: Flame Wave deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker and each creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls.
cards.flavor:
"I hear the roaring of a wave whose waters are red and whose mists are black."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText: Flame Wave deals 4 damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.

cards.name: Flashfires
cards.text: Destroy all Plains.
cards.flavor: Dry grass is tinder before the spark.
cards.originalText: Destroy all Plains.

cards.name: Flowstone Crusher
cards.text: {R}: Flowstone Crusher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"What's better than smashing things with a rock? A rock that gets up and smashes things for you."
—Toggo, goblin weaponsmith

rulings.text: Flowstone Crusher's ability can be activated multiple times, but Flowstone Crusher is put into the graveyard after an effect resolves that makes its toughness 0.

cards.originalText: {R}: Flowstone Crusher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Flowstone Shambler
cards.text: {R}: Flowstone Shambler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Flowstone troops are notoriously difficult to keep in formation.

foreignNames.name: 流動石のシャンブラー

cards.originalText: {R}: Flowstone Shambler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Flowstone Slide
cards.text: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It may look like soil, but its nature is malice.
cards.originalText: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.

cards.name: Form of the Dragon
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Form of the Dragon deals 5 damage to any target.
At the beginning of each end step, your life total becomes 5.
Creatures without flying can't attack you.

rulings.text: If you life total was above 5 at end of turn, then you lose life to make your total 5. If it was less than 5, you gain life to bring it to 5.
It sets your life total at the beginning of the end step of every player's turn, not just your own.
Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can't attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Form of the Dragon deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
At the end of each turn, your life total becomes 5.
Creatures without flying can't attack you.

cards.name: Furnace of Rath
cards.text: If a source would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
cards.flavor: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect. This means you can't normally end up with an odd amount of damage on something.
The trample rules cause damage to be divided before it is doubled.
If you have two of these on the battlefield, the damage is multiplied by 4.
The multiplied damage counts in all ways as if it came from the original source. Furnace of Rath is not the source.

If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt, the player who would be dealt damage or the controller of the creature that would be dealt damage chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, "Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn." Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to a player who has cast Mending Hands targeting themselves. That player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Furnace of Rath double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage.

cards.originalText: If a source would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.

cards.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
cards.text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They patched the holes, loaded their sharpest rocks, spanked their children one last time, and lurched off into the sunset.

rulings.text: You can activate the ability repeatedly during a turn. This generally has no additional effect, unless some other effect (like that from Adarkar Windform has caused it to lose flying since the last time the ability resolved.

For flying to work as an evasion ability, an attacking Goblin Balloon Brigade's ability must be activated before the declare blockers step begins. Once Goblin Balloon Brigade has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

cards.originalText: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Goblin Brigand
cards.text: Goblin Brigand attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor: Like a loaded cannon—point and shoot.
cards.originalText: Goblin Brigand attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Goblin Chariot
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.originalText: Other Goblins get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.name: Goblin Mountaineer
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: The only thing worse than a goblin is a goblin that knows his way around.
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.name: Goblin Piker
cards.flavor: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.

cards.name: Goblin Sky Raider
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: The goblin word for "flying" is more accurately translated as "falling slowly."
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Guerrilla Tactics
cards.text:
Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to any target.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to any target.

rulings.text: If it is discarded, the damage done by it is done by this card due to an ability and not by a spell.
The second ability will trigger even on an optional discard caused by an opponent.
Discarding as a cost to cast a spell will not trigger the ability. Only discarding as an effect will trigger the ability.

cards.originalText:
Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Hill Giant
cards.flavor: Fortunately, hill giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

cards.name: Karplusan Yeti
cards.text: {T}: Karplusan Yeti deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Karplusan Yeti.

rulings.text: Giving either creature first strike does not affect the ability.

If this leaves the battlefield before its activated ability resolves, it will still deal damage to the targeted creature. On the other hand, if the targeted creature leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the ability won't resolve and no damage will be dealt.

foreignNames.name: カープルーザンのイエティ

cards.originalText: {T}: Karplusan Yeti deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Karplusan Yeti.

cards.name: Kird Ape
cards.text: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.
cards.flavor: It puts the "fur" in "fury."
cards.originalText: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: "Catch!"
cards.originalText: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.name: Lightning Elemental
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Magnivore
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Magnivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of sorcery cards in all graveyards.
cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes under your control.)
Magnivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of sorcery cards in all graveyards.

cards.name: Mana Clash
cards.text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

rulings.text: Always affects the player and targets one of their opponents.
Each point of damage is dealt separately, so if you are damaged twice by this spell, each time is considered a separate time this source deals damage.
This card's coin flip has no winner or loser.

cards.originalText: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

cards.name: Mogg Sentry
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Nothing makes a mogg madder than having to wake up.
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent plays a spell, Mogg Sentry gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ogre Taskmaster
cards.text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
cards.flavor: Three little goblins, enjoying their brew. One bumped an ogre, and then there were two.
cards.originalText: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.

cards.name: Orcish Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"So they want to kill my men? Well two can play at that game."
—General Khurzog

rulings.text: You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability doesn't resolve because the target is illegal.

cards.originalText: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Panic Attack
cards.text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: Sometimes everyone decides to go for help at the same time.
cards.originalText: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.

cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage
cards.originalText: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Rathi Dragon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Rathi Dragon enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice two Mountains.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
When Rathi Dragon comes into play, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice two Mountains.

cards.name: Reflexes
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
cards.flavor: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.originalText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

cards.name: Rogue Kavu
cards.text: Whenever Rogue Kavu attacks alone, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Every litter of kavu yields one cub that refuses to hunt with the pack.
cards.originalText: Whenever Rogue Kavu attacks alone, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Rukh Egg
cards.text: When Rukh Egg dies, create a 4/4 red Bird creature token with flying at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Called "stonefeathers" by many lowlanders, rukhs are thought to descend from a phoenix that sacrificed its flame for a body of stone.

rulings.text: If the Rukh Egg card is removed from the graveyard in the same turn it is put there, a Bird will still be put onto the battlefield.
If the Egg is exiled instead of being put into the graveyard, no Bird is put onto the battlefield.
Text-changing effects can be used to change the color of the Bird that will be put onto the battlefield.
If the Egg is destroyed while under the control of another player, the controller of the Egg gets the Bird.

cards.originalText: When Rukh Egg is put into a graveyard from play, put a 4/4 red Bird creature token with flying into play at end of turn.

cards.name: Sandstone Warrior
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
{R}: Sandstone Warrior gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
{R}: Sandstone Warrior gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Seething Song
cards.text: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}.
cards.flavor:
"The purest ore is produced from the hottest furnace, and the brightest thunder-bolt is elicited from the darkest storm."
—Charles Colton
cards.originalText: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Shard Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Shard Phoenix: It deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
{R}{R}{R}: Return Shard Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: You can return Shard Phoenix any time during your upkeep; this is not a beginning of upkeep triggered ability.
Shard Phoenix uses Last Known Information. If, for example, it was blue when it was sacrificed, the damage will come from a blue source.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
Sacrifice Shard Phoenix: Shard Phoenix deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
{R}{R}{R}: Return Shard Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Shock

cards.flavor:
"Once I saw a goblin shouting at a thunderstorm. He lost the argument pretty quickly."
—Wandering mage
cards.originalText: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Sudden Impact
cards.text: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Some say it's better to think before you act. While those people are considering all the options, that's usually when I kill them."
—Dravus, lava mage
cards.originalText: Sudden Impact deals damage equal to the number of cards in target player's hand to that player.

cards.name: Threaten
cards.text: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor: Goblins' motivational techniques are crude, but effective.
cards.originalText: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It may attack this turn.)

cards.name: Thundermare
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
When Thundermare enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.
cards.flavor: Its hooves strike lightning and the thunder follows quickly after.
cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes under your control.)
When Thundermare comes into play, tap all other creatures.

cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
cards.flavor:
"Some believe sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

rulings.text: It is returned to its owner's hand at the end of any turn in which it is on the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: ヴィーアシーノの砂漠の狩人

cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes under your control.)
At end of turn, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's in play.)

cards.name: Volcanic Hammer
cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.
cards.originalText: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Whip Sergeant
cards.text: {R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack this turn.)
cards.flavor: Keldon soldiers learn to move faster than the whip.
cards.originalText: {R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn. (It may attack this turn.)

cards.name: Wildfire
cards.text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor: Fire is always at the top of the food chain, and it has a big appetite.
cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Anaconda
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: If you're smaller than the anaconda, it considers you food. If you're larger than the anaconda, it considers you a lot of food.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.name: Ancient Silverback
cards.text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

foreignNames.name: 年経たシルバーバック

cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Biorhythm
cards.text: Each player's life total becomes the number of creatures they control.
cards.flavor:
"I have seen life's purpose, and now it is my own."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

rulings.text: If a player controls no creatures when this resolves, their life total will become zero and they will lose the game.
This spell causes the player to lose or gain enough life to change to the new life total.

cards.originalText: Each player's life total becomes the number of creatures he or she controls.

cards.name: Blanchwood Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.

cards.name: Craw Wurm
cards.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
cards.flavor: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

cards.name: Early Harvest
cards.text: Target player untaps all basic lands they control.
cards.flavor:
"Earth's increase, foison plenty,
Barns and garners never empty:
Vines with clust'ring bunches growing;
Plants with goodly burden bowing."
—William Shakespeare, The Tempest
cards.originalText: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.

cards.name: Elvish Bard
cards.text: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.
cards.flavor: Helplessly drawn in, the bard's enemies quickly find there's more than song to be found.
cards.originalText: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.

cards.name: Elvish Berserker
cards.text: Whenever Elvish Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
cards.flavor: Their fury scatters enemies like a pile of dry leaves.
cards.originalText: Whenever Elvish Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

cards.name: Elvish Champion
cards.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn

rulings.text: It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

foreignNames.name: エルフのチャンピオン

cards.originalText: Other Elves get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.name: Elvish Piper
cards.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Put a creature card from your hand into play.

cards.name: Elvish Warrior
cards.flavor: "My tales of war are the stories most asked for around the fires at night, but they're the ones I care least to tell."

cards.name: Emperor Crocodile
cards.text: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.
cards.flavor: The king of Yavimaya's waters pays constant attention to his subjects . . . and thrives on their adulation.

rulings.text: Emperor Crocodile's ability will trigger if you don't control another creature, even if it's only for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability (such as that of Brago, King Eternal).
The ability only checks if you control no other creatures at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution, so gaining control of a creature before then will not save Emperor Crocodile.

cards.originalText: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.
cards.originalText:
Trample (If this creature would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
Watching the spider's web
—Llanowar expression meaning
"focusing on the wrong thing"

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Giant Spider can block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Greater Good
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then discard three cards.
cards.flavor:
"To examine the causes of life, we must first have recourse to death."
—Mary Shelley, Frankenstein

rulings.text: You must discard three cards regardless of how many cards you drew. If you have less than three cards in hand, you discard your hand.
You draw cards equal to the creature's power when you sacrificed it. This includes any bonuses from effects like Giant Growth.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then discard three cards.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

cards.name: Groundskeeper
cards.text: {1}{G}: Return target basic land card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "Soldiers speak of defending the soil, but they care only for their nations. I care nothing for their nations and everything for the soil."
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Return target basic land card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Hunted Wumpus
cards.text: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from their hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.

foreignNames.name: 狩り立てられたウンパス

cards.originalText: When Hunted Wumpus comes into play, each other player may put a creature card from his or her hand into play.

cards.name: Kavu Climber
cards.text: When Kavu Climber enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"There was a crack of branches, a rustle of leaves, then a tremendous roar. Our party had no chance as death descended from above."
—Taseen, elvish bard
cards.originalText: When Kavu Climber comes into play, draw a card.

cards.name: King Cheetah
cards.text: Flash
cards.flavor:
If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a king cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend.
—Suq'Ata wisdom

rulings.text: King Cheetah is always a Creature spell, never an instant, regardless of when you cast it.

cards.originalText: You may play King Cheetah any time you could play an instant.

cards.name: Ley Druid
cards.text: {T}: Untap target land.
cards.flavor: After years of training, the druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

rulings.text: The land is untapped as a normal ability that goes on the stack. It is not a mana ability, so it can't be used at times that only mana abilities can be used.

cards.originalText: {T}: Untap target land.

cards.name: Llanowar Behemoth
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Llanowar Behemoth gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Most people can't build decent weapons out of stone or steel. Trust the elves to do it with only mud and vines."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: Since the activated ability doesn't have a tap symbol in its cost, you can tap a creature (including Llanowar Behemoth itself) that hasn't been under your control since your most recent turn began to pay the cost.

foreignNames.name: ラノワールのビヒモス

cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Llanowar Behemoth gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Maro
cards.text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: No two see the same Maro.

rulings.text: Creatures are only put into a graveyard for having 0 toughness when state-based actions are checked. If Maro's toughness goes to 0 during the announcement or resolution of a spell or ability and then goes back up above 0 before the end of that announcement or resolution, it won't be put into your graveyard when state-based actions are checked.

cards.originalText: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Might of Oaks
cards.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Natural Affinity
cards.text: All lands become 2/2 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
cards.flavor: As long as the dryads are a part of the forest, the forest is a part of the army.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, all lands become 2/2 creatures that are still lands.

cards.name: Natural Spring
cards.text: Target player gains 8 life.
cards.flavor: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.
cards.originalText: Target player gains 8 life.

cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Well, it also makes a very nice flower pot. . . ."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Needle Storm
cards.text: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The rain is driven like nails.
cards.originalText: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Norwood Ranger
cards.flavor: The song of the forest is in perfect harmony. If a single note is out of place, the elves will find its source.

foreignNames.name: ノーウッドのレインジャー

cards.name: Order of the Sacred Bell
cards.flavor: "My brother, it may now be time to ring the bell and put out the call for aid."

cards.name: Overgrowth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}{G}.

rulings.text: This is a triggered mana ability.

cards.originalText:
Enchant land (Target a land as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that land.)
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G}{G} to his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Reclaim
cards.text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.flavor: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.
cards.originalText: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: River Bear
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: The bears had been isolated on an island for hundreds of years, until the island sank and the bears didn't.
cards.originalText: Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.name: Rootbreaker Wurm
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.originalText: Trample (If this creature would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)

cards.name: Rootwalla
cards.text: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.

rulings.text: If this card's ability is activated by one player, then another player takes control of it on the same turn, the second player can't activate its ability that turn.

cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Scaled Wurm
cards.flavor: The wurms become so big, a single scale can be used as a roof for a human dwelling.
